titles.title: Indian Tribal Development Corporation Feasibility Study Act of 2004
A bill to determine the feasibility of establishing an Indian Tribal Development Corporation.
A bill to establish a Native American-owned financial entity to provide financial services to Indian tribes, Native American organizations, and Native Americans, and for other purposes.
Indian Tribal Development Corporation Feasibility Study Act of 2004
Indian Tribal Development Corporation Feasibility Study Act of 2004
Native American Capital Formation and Economic Development Act of 2003

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Indian Affairs.
Committee on Indian Affairs. Hearings held. Hearings printed: S.Hrg. 108-75.
Committee on Indian Affairs. Hearings held. Hearings printed: S.Hrg. 108-673.
Committee on Indian Affairs. Ordered to be reported with an amendment in the nature of a substitute favorably.

Committee on Indian Affairs. Reported by Senator Campbell under authority of the order of the Senate of 10/11/04 with an amendment in the nature of a substitute and an amendment to the title. With written report No. 108-404.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 795.

vote.text: Passed Senate with an amendment and an amendment to the Title by Unanimous Consent.

reference.label: text of measure as reported in Senate

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Referred to the House Committee on Resources.

term.name: Civil Rights and Liberties, Minority Issues

bill.summary: Indian Tribal Development Corporation Feasibility Study Act of 2004 - Amends the Native American Business Development, Trade Promotion, and Tourism Act of 2000 to direct the Secretary of Commerce to establish the Tribal Development Corporation Feasibility Study Group to study and report to Congress on the feasibility of establishing an Indian Tribal Development Corporation. Authorizes appropriations for FY 2005 and 2006.
